alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marion and northeastern Lamar Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Detroit, or 10 miles north of Sulligent, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Guin, Detroit, Beaverton, Crews, Henson Springs, Byrd, Marion County Public Lake, Rankin Fite Airport and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
